<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 117, 379, 142]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 246, 505, 262]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 285]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 286, 539, 317]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 336, 228, 351]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 352, 880, 522]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 565, 570, 612]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 335, 106, 352]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 335, 920, 383]]<|/det|> A pulse of sound is produced at the bottom of a boat. The sound travels through the water and is reflected from the seabed. The reflected sound reaches the boat 1.3s after the sound was produced. The seabed is \(1000 \text{m}\) below the boat. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 392, 621, 540]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 553, 640, 571]]<|/det|> Using this information, what is the speed of sound in the water? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 581, 134, 599]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 581, 175, 599]]<|/det|> 770 m/s <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 581, 303, 599]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 581, 401, 599]]<|/det|> 1300 m/s <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 581, 473, 599]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[480, 581, 556, 599]]<|/det|> 1500 m/s <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[616, 581, 640, 599]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[643, 581, 737, 599]]<|/det|> 2600 m/s <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 628, 107, 645]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 628, 658, 645]]<|/det|> The diagram shows three small compasses near to a bar magnet. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 655, 628, 797]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 813, 794, 831]]<|/det|> Which compasses show the direction of the magnetic field due to the bar magnet? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 842, 134, 860]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 842, 175, 860]]<|/det|> P and Q <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 842, 303, 860]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 842, 374, 860]]<|/det|> P only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 842, 473, 860]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[480, 842, 560, 860]]<|/det|> Q and R <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 842, 636, 860]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[650, 842, 710, 860]]<|/det|> Q only

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 850, 381, 867]]<|/det|>
